Class ServerController

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.network.server.ServerController
public class ServerController extends Object
The ServerController acts as the central point for handling all game-related requests received from clients. It is a Singleton to ensure a single point of control for managing game instances and client interactions on the server side. It delegates specific game logic operations to the GameManager and individual GameServer instances.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerController

      public ServerController()

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ServerController getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the ServerController. If the instance does not exist, it creates one.
      Returns:
      The single instance of ServerController.

    • addClientToAccept

      public int addClientToAccept(VirtualClient client)
      Adds a new client's VirtualClient proxy to the GameManager for initial acceptance and potential game assignment.
      Parameters:
      client - The VirtualClient object representing the connected client.
      Returns:
      A temporary ID assigned to the client.

    • handleNickname

      public void handleNickname(int idClient, String nickname)
      Handles the nickname submitted by a client. It delegates to the GameManager to associate the nickname with the client's temporary ID and potentially add them to a game.
      Parameters:
      idClient - The temporary ID assigned to the client during connection.
      nickname - The nickname chosen by the client.

    • handleGameInfo

      public void handleGameInfo(GameInfo gameInfo, String nickname)
      Handles the game setup information provided by a client (typically the host). It retrieves the waiting game from the GameManager and configures it with the specified game mode and number of players.
      Parameters:
      gameInfo - The GameInfo containing the game mode and number of players.
      nickname - The nickname of the player providing the game information.

    • addComponent

      public void addComponent(int idGame, String nickname, int idComp, Cordinate cordinate, int rotations)
      Handles a request from a client to add a component to their ship board. It updates the player's ShipBoard with the new component. It broadcasts this update to all other clients in the same game, so their views can be synchronized.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game to which the component is being added.
      nickname - The nickname of the player adding the component.
      idComp - The ID of the component being added.
      cordinate - The Cordinate on the ship board where the component is placed.
      rotations - The number of rotations applied to the component.

    • getCoveredComponent

      public void getCoveredComponent(int idGame, String nickname)
      Handles a request from a client to get a covered component from the FlyBoard. It removes a component from the covered components stack on the FlyBoard and sends it to the requesting client, then updates the client's state.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting the component.

    • discardComponent

      public void discardComponent(int idGame, int idComponent)
      Handles a request from a client to discard a component. The discarded component is added back to the uncovered components pool on the FlyBoard. This update is then broadcast to all clients in the game to synchronize their views.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      idComponent - The ID of the component to discard.

    • drawUncovered

      public void drawUncovered(int idGame, String nickname, Integer idComponent)
      Handles a request from a client to draw an uncovered component. If the component exists in the uncovered components pool, it is removed, broadcasted as removed to all other clients, and then set in the requesting client's hand, and their state is updated. If the component is not found, the client's state is set to GameState.UNABLE_UNCOVERED_COMPONENT.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting to draw the component.
      idComponent - The ID of the component to draw.

    • bookDeck

      public void bookDeck(int idGame, String nickname, Integer deckNumber)
      Handles a request from a client to book a specific deck of cards. It attempts to remove the requested deck from the list of available decks. If successful, it broadcasts the removal to all clients, sets the deck in the requesting client's hand, and updates their state. If the deck is not available, the client's state is set to GameState.UNABLE_DECK. Synchronization on flyBoard.getAvailableDecks() ensures thread safety when modifying the list of available decks.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player attempting to book the deck.
      deckNumber - The number of the deck to book.

    • freeDeck

      public void freeDeck(int idGame, String nickname, Integer deckNumber)
      Frees a previously booked deck, making it available again. The deck is added back to the pool of available decks on the FlyBoard. This update is then broadcast to all clients in the game to synchronize their views. The requesting client's state is updated to GameState.BUILDING_SHIP.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player freeing the deck.
      deckNumber - The number of the deck to free.

    • takeBuild

      public void takeBuild(int idGame, String nickname)
      Handles a player's request to "take build," meaning they claim a constructed ship. The player is associated with a constructed ship on the FlyBoard. This action is then broadcast to all clients to update their game state. If the ship cannot be taken due to game rules (e.g., no available ship), the player's state is updated to reflect an invalid choice.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player taking the build.

    • endValidation

      public void endValidation(int idGame, String nickname, boolean usedBattery)
      Handles the completion of the ship building phase and initiates validation. After a player indicates they've finished building, their ship's validity is checked. If the ship is invalid, the player's state is updated to prompt re-validation. If valid, guests are added to the ship. If all players have validated their ships (and no adventure card has been played yet), the game proceeds to the "add crew" phase. If an adventure card was played, the logic branches based on the card type.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player who ended validation.
      usedBattery - A boolean indicating whether the player used a battery during validation (relevant for some card effects).

    • getStartingPosition

      public void getStartingPosition(int idGame, String nickname)
      Retrieves the available starting positions for a player in a specific game and sends them to the client. Sets the client's state to CHOOSE_POSITION. If an error occurs, the game crash is handled.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

    • choosePlace

      public void choosePlace(int idGame, String nickname, int place)
      Allows a player to choose a starting position on the game board. Adds the player to the circuit and broadcasts an AddPlayerCircuit event. If the chosen place is invalid, the client is informed and their state is set to WRONG_POSITION. If the board is ready for the adventure, all players' states are set to VALIDATION.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      place - The chosen starting position.

    • endBuild

      public void endBuild(int idGame, String nickname)
      Handles the end of the building phase for a player in a game. If the game is not in testing mode, it sends the available starting positions to the client and sets their state to CHOOSE_POSITION. If an error occurs, the game crash is handled.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(int idGame, String nickname)
      Allows the leader player to draw a SldAdvCard from the deck. If the current player is not the leader, a NotYourTurnException is thrown. If the drawn card is a special card (ID 16 or 36) and there's only one player, it repeatedly draws until a different card is found or the deck is empty. If the deck is empty, the game ends. The drawn card is then set as the played card, and relevant events are broadcast to all players. The card's effect is initialized and applied, potentially setting the next meteor or player.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player drawing the card.
      Throws:
      NotYourTurnException - If the player attempting to draw is not the leader.

    • setEndGame

      public void setEndGame(int idGame)
      Ends the game, calculates final scores, and notifies all clients of the game's end. This includes assigning credits for positions, beautiful ships, and remaining goods, as well as applying penalties for discarded components.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game to end.

    • drawCardTest

      public void drawCardTest(int idGame, String nickname, int idCard)
      Allows the leader player to draw a specific SldAdvCard by its ID for testing purposes. If the current player is not the leader, a NotYourTurnException is thrown. The drawn card is then set as the played card.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player drawing the card.
      idCard - The ID of the card to draw.
      Throws:
      NotYourTurnException - If the player attempting to draw is not the leader.

    • activateDoubleEngine

      public void activateDoubleEngine(int idGame, String nickname, int number)
      Activates the double engine effect for a player based on the currently played SldAdvCard. This method handles the specific logic for "SldOpenSpace" and "SldCombatZone" cards. For "SldOpenSpace", it attempts to apply the card's effect. If an exception occurs during application, a generic error message is sent to the client. For "SldCombatZone", it records the player's engine power and sets the next player for engine activation. Logs an error if the played card is not valid for this effect.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player activating the double engine.
      number - The value associated with the double engine activation (e.g., engine power).

    • leaveFlight

      public void leaveFlight(int idGame, String nickname, boolean leave)
      Manages a player's decision to leave or stay in the current flight phase of a game. If the player chooses to leave, they are removed from the scoreboard, a LeavePlayerEvent is broadcast, and if no players remain, the game ends. Regardless of their choice to leave or stay, the player is removed from the list of waiting players. If all waiting players have made their choice, the game transitions to the card drawing phase, with the leader being notified that they can draw a card, and other players being notified to expect a card draw.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      leave - A boolean indicating whether the player chooses to leave (true) or stay (false).

    • skipEffect

      public void skipEffect(int idGame, String nickname, int idCard)
      Skips the effect of the currently played SldAdvCard for a specific player if it's their turn and the card matches. The method handles different card types by invoking their respective "skip effect" or "set next player/planet" logic. If the card is not implemented for skipping effects, an error is logged.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player attempting to skip the effect.
      idCard - The ID of the card whose effect is to be skipped.

    • applyEffect

      public void applyEffect(int idGame, String nickname)
      Applies the effect of the currently played SldAdvCard for a specific player. This method handles the application of effects for "SldAbandonedStation" and "SldSlavers" cards. If the card's effect is not applicable through this method, an error is logged.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player for whom the effect is being applied.

    • removeCrew

      public void removeCrew(int idGame, String nickname, List<Cordinate> cordToRemove)
      Removes crew members from the game board based on the effect of the currently played SldAdvCard. This method handles crew removal for "SldAbandonedShip," "SldSlavers," and "SldCombatZone" cards. If the card's effect does not involve crew removal, an error is logged.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose crew members are being removed.
      cordToRemove - A list of coordinates indicating the positions of the crew members to remove.

    • addGood

      public void addGood(int idGame, String nickname, int idComp, GoodType type)
      Adds a good of a specific type to a component on the game board. This method also broadcasts events to update all clients about the added good, removes the good from pending status for the player, and changes the player's card state. If the good cannot be added to the specified component due to an IncorrectShipBoardException, an error message is sent to the client, and game crash handling is initiated if further errors occur.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player adding the good.
      idComp - The ID of the component to which the good is being added.
      type - The type of good to add.

    • removeGood

      public void removeGood(int idGame, String nickname, int idComp, GoodType type)
      Removes a good of a specific type from a component on the game board. This method broadcasts events to update all clients about the removed good, adds the good back to pending status for the player, and changes the player's card state.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player removing the good.
      idComp - The ID of the component from which the good is being removed.
      type - The type of good to remove.

    • landOnPlanet

      public void landOnPlanet(int idGame, String nickname, int choice)
      Handles a player's action of landing on a planet during a "SldPlanets" card effect. Logs the player's choice and updates all clients about the player's new position. If all players have landed or all planets have been landed on, the card's effect is applied. Otherwise, the card's effect moves to the next player.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player landing on a planet.
      choice - The chosen planet number to land on, or -1 if no planet is chosen.

    • activateDoubleDrills

      public void activateDoubleDrills(int idGame, String nickname, List<Cordinate> drillCordinates)
      Activates the double drills effect for a player based on the currently played SldAdvCard. This method handles the specific logic for "SldSmugglers," "SldPirates," "SldSlavers," and "SldCombatZone" cards, applying their respective effects related to drill coordinates. Logs an error if the played card is not valid for this effect.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player activating the double drills.
      drillCordinates - A list of coordinates representing the drill positions.

    • setRollResult

      public void setRollResult(int idGame, String nickname, int first, int second)
      Sets the result of a dice roll and applies its effect based on the currently played SldAdvCard. This method handles the logic for "SldMeteorSwarm," "SldPirates," and "SldCombatZone" cards. For "SldMeteorSwarm," it calculates the hit value, applies it to players, and determines the next meteor. For "SldPirates" and "SldCombatZone," it calculates cannon hit events and broadcasts them to relevant players. Logs an error if no effect is defined for the given card for a roll result.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player who rolled the dice.
      first - The result of the first die.
      second - The result of the second die.

    • advanceMeteor

      public void advanceMeteor(int idGame, String nickname, boolean destroyed, boolean energy)
      Advances the state of a meteor effect on the game board, typically in response to a player's action (e.g., repairing damage). This method is specifically designed to work with SldMeteorSwarm cards. Logs an error if the played card is not a SldMeteorSwarm.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player interacting with the meteor.
      destroyed - A boolean indicating if a component was destroyed.
      energy - A boolean indicating if energy was used.

    • advanceCannon

      public void advanceCannon(int idGame, String nickname, boolean destroyed, boolean energy)
      Advances the state of a cannon effect on the game board, typically in response to a player's action (e.g., repairing damage). This method is specifically designed to work with SldPirates and SldCombatZone cards. Logs an error if the played card is not a SldPirates or SldCombatZone.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player interacting with the cannon.
      destroyed - A boolean indicating if a component was destroyed.
      energy - A boolean indicating if energy was used.

    • startHourglass

      public void startHourglass(int idGame)
      Starts the hourglass timer for a game and notifies all clients that the hourglass has started. This typically indicates a timed phase of the game has begun. If a client crashes during notification, the game crash is handled.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.

    • removeComponent

      public void removeComponent(int idGame, String nickname, Cordinate cord)
      Removes a component from a player's ship board in a game. If no card is currently played, the removal is directly broadcast to all other clients. If a card is played, a RemoveComponentEvent is added to the game's event queue. Throws an IncorrectFlyBoardException if the provided nickname does not correspond to a player in the game. If a client crashes during component removal notification, the game crash is handled.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose component is being removed.
      cord - The coordinates of the component to remove.
      Throws:
      IncorrectFlyBoardException - if the nickname does not belong to a player in the game.

    • removeComponentToAll

      public void removeComponentToAll(int idGame, String nickname, Cordinate cord)
      Removes a component from a player's ship board in a game and broadcasts this removal to all clients. Throws an IncorrectFlyBoardException if the provided nickname does not correspond to a player in the game. If a client crashes during component removal notification, the game crash is handled.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose component is being removed.
      cord - The coordinates of the component to remove.
      Throws:
      IncorrectFlyBoardException - if the nickname does not belong to a player in the game.

    • addCrew

      public void addCrew(int idGame, String nickname, Map<Cordinate,List<GuestType>> addedCrew)
      Adds crew members to a player's ship board in a game. It validates if the crew can be added to the specified components and if the total number of certain guest types is valid. If the addition is valid, the crew is added to the components and AddCrewEvents are broadcast. If invalid, the player's state is reset to ADD_CREW to allow them to re-attempt. After processing, the player is removed from the list of players needing to add crew. If all players have added their crew, the game transitions to the card drawing phase, with the leader allowed to draw a card and others waiting for a card draw.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game.
      nickname - The nickname of the player adding crew.
      addedCrew - A map where keys are coordinates and values are lists of GuestType to add at those coordinates.

    • handleGameCrash

      public void handleGameCrash(Exception e, String nickname, int idGame)
      Handles a game crash scenario. Logs the crash details, broadcasts a CrashEvent to all players in the affected game, and then removes the ongoing game from the game manager. If the game has already been removed, a warning is logged.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception that caused the crash.
      nickname - The nickname of the client involved in the crash.
      idGame - The ID of the game where the crash occurred.
